citeinfo.title: Archeological Remains of Fish, Mammals and Birds from the Western Aleutians (Shemya & Buldir Islands) Dated to 3,000 - 3,500 B.P.

descript.abstract: Archeological remains of fish, mammals and birds from the western Aleutians (Shemya & Buldir Islands) dated to 3,000 - 3,500 B.P. Our company has identified fish only - data set contains Pacific cod, pollock, halibut, Atka mackerel, rockfish, other flatfish, sculpins, etc;...bones well preserved
descript.purpose: Used to reconstruct environmental conditions and compare resource use over time by indigenous people. Potential additional uses include making size estimates and constructing age profiles of populations over time and also DNA sample sources ( e.g., sea otter, fur seal, etc..)

idinfo.accconst: Should be publically available after publication
idinfo.useconst: None on data. Further analysis (e.g., DNA) on bone may require permission.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.

metainfo.metstdn: Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
metainfo.metac: Should be publically available after publication
metainfo.metuc: None on data. Further analysis (e.g., DNA) on bone may require permission.
